## Description {#details}

A wrapper class for fallible iterators.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fallible-iterator">fallible&#95;iterator</a> template wraps an underlying iterator-like class whose increment and decrement operations are replaced with fallible versions like:


<ProgramListing extension="cpp">

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac226f3d2b9ca090171a8e0a8cb92c343a902b0d55fddef6f8d651fe1035b7d4bd">Error</a> inc();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac226f3d2b9ca090171a8e0a8cb92c343a902b0d55fddef6f8d651fe1035b7d4bd">Error</a> dec();</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


It produces an interface that is (mostly) compatible with a traditional c++ iterator, including ++ and â€“ operators that do not fail.

Instances of the wrapper are constructed with an instance of the underlying iterator and (for non-end iterators) a reference to an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> instance. If the underlying increment/decrement operations fail, the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> is returned via this reference, and the resulting iterator value set to an end-of-range sentinel value. This enables the following loop idiom:


<ProgramListing extension="cpp">

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a55749dd7f26bf4b47fa523da208cc038ae727b00944f81e1d0a95c12886ac4641">Archive</a> &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// E.g. Potentially malformed on-disk archive</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  fallible&#95;iterator&lt;ArchiveChildItr&gt; children&#95;begin(Error &amp;Err);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  fallible&#95;iterator&lt;ArchiveChildItr&gt; children&#95;end();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  iterator&#95;range&lt;fallible&#95;iterator&lt;ArchiveChildItr&gt;&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#acc2e6a2001a5f102f18060a53520e82b">children</a>(Error &amp;Err) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a341215803e83773a3e97860dc291f121">make&#95;range</a>(children&#95;begin(Err), children&#95;end());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> walk(Archive &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lltok/#af353621f14cb4b4b3af5ffaff84076b1a3766a4dce43f4efc7208a749cc7ac605">Error</a> Err = Error::success();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a1960c14773241d6a238d2db593abe552">C</a> : <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.children(Err)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Loop body only entered when increment succeeds.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Err) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handle error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


The wrapper marks the referenced <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> as unchecked after each increment and/or decrement operation, and clears the unchecked flag when a non-end value is compared against end (since, by the increment invariant, not being an end value proves that there was no error, and is equivalent to checking that the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> is success). This allows early exits from the loop body without requiring redundant error checks.

Definition at line 68 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h">fallible&#95;iterator.h</a>.

## Friends

### operator!= {#a1be8eff3b1f82e06ad3fb6237fe4c419}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>friend bool <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fallible-iterator">fallible&#95;iterator</a> &amp; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fallible-iterator">fallible&#95;iterator</a> &amp; RHS</>}

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h/#l00189">189</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h">fallible&#95;iterator.h</a>.

### operator== {#aa7ecffd56a28eaa6027810ae50d30c7c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>friend bool <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fallible-iterator">fallible&#95;iterator</a> &amp; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fallible-iterator">fallible&#95;iterator</a> &amp; RHS</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Compare fallible iterators for equality.

Returns true if both LHS and RHS are end-of-range values, or if both are non-end-of-range values whose underlying iterator values compare equal.

If this is a comparison between an end-of-range iterator and a non-end-of-range iterator, then the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> (referenced by the non-end-of-range value) is marked as checked: Since all increment/decrement operations result in an end-of-range value, comparing false against end-of-range is equivalent to checking that the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> value is success. This flag management enables early returns from loop bodies without redundant <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> checks.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h/#l00162">162</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h">fallible&#95;iterator.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

## Public Operators

### operator--() {#a9fbbeee35c8f16d816e97c1558d8ca55}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename Underlying&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>fallible&#95;iterator &amp; llvm::fallible&#95;iterator&lt; Underlying &gt;::operator-- ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Decrement the fallible iterator.

If the underlying &#39;dec&#39; operation fails, this will set the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> value and update this iterator value to point to end-of-range.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> value is marked as needing checking, regardless of whether the &#39;dec&#39; operation succeeds or fails.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h/#l00141">141</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h">fallible&#95;iterator.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### operator++() {#ab86deeb1b659f4f9406c114b2aaa9319}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename Underlying&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>fallible&#95;iterator &amp; llvm::fallible&#95;iterator&lt; Underlying &gt;::operator++ ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Increment the fallible iterator.

If the underlying &#39;inc&#39; operation fails, this will set the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> value and update this iterator value to point to end-of-range.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> value is marked as needing checking, regardless of whether the &#39;inc&#39; operation succeeds or fails.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Static Functions

### end() {#a1885ab71cce9418d89aa8ca952021241}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename Underlying&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>static fallible&#95;iterator llvm::fallible&#95;iterator&lt; Underlying &gt;::end (Underlying I)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Construct a fallible iterator that can be used as an end-of-range value.

A value created by this method can be dereferenced (if the underlying value points at a valid value) and compared, but not incremented or decremented.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h/#l00094">94</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h">fallible&#95;iterator.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### itr() {#a5e324def628fb970ffc152836f145972}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename Underlying&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>static fallible&#95;iterator llvm::fallible&#95;iterator&lt; Underlying &gt;::itr (Underlying I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> &amp; Err)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Construct a fallible iterator that <em>cannot</em> be used as an end-of-range value.

A value created by this method can be dereferenced, incremented, decremented and compared, providing the underlying type supports it.

The error that is passed in will be initially marked as checked, so if the iterator is not used at all the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> need not be checked.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h/#l00084">84</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/fallible-iterator-h">fallible&#95;iterator.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
